availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
State of Massachusetts
County of Suffolk } SS.

I, Joseph L. Lord, residing in the city of Boston, in the County of Suffolk, in the State of Massachusetts, appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky, a Commissioner of Deeds "under Chapter 70 of the Act of the General Assembly of said Commonwealth, Entitled 'An Act to adopt the Revised Statutes', approved January 7th. 1852", for the State of Kentucky, do solemnly swear that I will well and faithfully execute and perform all the duties of such Commissioner under and by virtue of the laws of the said State of Kentucky.

figure.ab:
JOSEPH L. LORD,
A COMMISSIONER OF DEEDS
for Kentucky
BOSTON, MASSACHUSETTS

body.p:
Commonwealth of Massachusetts.
Suffolk SS April 6th, A. D. 1863
Subscribed & sworn to by the above named Joseph L. Lord.

Before me,
Francis B. Hayes,
Justice of the Peace throughout the Commonwealth of Massachusetts --

Massachusetts
Oath
Jos L. Lord
Comr of Deeds
Filed April 11th 1863
